contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox software | name = Yacas | screenshot = [[Image:Yacas-texmacs-gnuplot.png|300px]] | caption = Yacas as a [[TeXmacs]] session | developer = Ayal Pinkus et al. | status = Active | latest_release_version = 1.3.3 | latest_release_date = {{release date|2012|08|19}} | programming language = [[C++]] | operating_system = [[Cross-platform]] | genre = [[Computer algebra system]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPL]] | website = {{URL|http://yacas.sourceforge.net/}} }} '''Yacas''' {{IPAc-en|ˈ|j|æ|k|ə|s}} is a general-purpose [[computer algebra system]]. The name is an acronym for ''[[Yet another|Yet Another]] Computer Algebra System''. Released under the [[GNU General Public License]], Yacas is [[free software]]. YACAS is a program for symbolic manipulation of mathematical expressions. It uses its own [[programming language]] designed for symbolic as well as [[arbitrary-precision arithmetic|arbitrary-precision]] numerical computations. The system has a library of scripts that implement many of the symbolic algebra operations; new algorithms can be easily added to the library. YACAS comes with extensive documentation covering the scripting language, the functionality that is already implemented in the system, and the algorithms used. Yacas handles input and output in plain [[ASCII]] or in [[OpenMath]], either interactively or in batch mode. ==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} *[[Euler (software)|Euler]], a numerical software package that can be linked with YACAS *[[Comparison of computer algebra systems]] ==References== {{Reflist}} * {{cite book |url= http://www.springerlink.com/content/j368wkh0yq00bdp3/ |chapter=Yacas : A Do-It-Yourself Symbolic Algebra Environment |first1=Ayal Z. |last1=Pinkus |first2=Serge |last2=Winitzki |title=Artificial Intelligence, Automated Reasoning, and Symbolic Computation |series=Lecture Notes in Computer Science|year=2002|volume=2385 |pages=81–158 |publisher=[[Springer (publisher)|Springer]] }} * {{cite journal |last1=Filip |first1=Xenia |first2=Claudiu |last2=Filip |title=SD-CAS: Spin Dynamics by Computer Algebra System |work=Journal of Magnetic Resonance|volume=207|issue=1|year=2010|pages=95–113 |publisher=[[Elsevier]] }} * {{cite journal |url= http://www.springer.com/computer/database+management+%26+information+retrieval/book/978-3-642-03425-1 |last=Goguadze |first=George |title=Semantic Evaluation Services for Web-Based Exercises |work=Advances in Web Based Learning–ICWL 2009|year=2009|pages=172–181 |publisher=[[Springer (publisher)|Springer]] }} * {{cite journal |url= http://www.wseas.us/e-library/conferences/2008/crete/education/education51.pdf |first1=Hugo |last1=Coll |first2=Diana |last2=Bri |first3=Miguel |last3=Garcia |first4=Jaime |last4=Lloret |title=Free software and open source applications in higher education |work=5th WSEAS / IASME International Conference on Engineering Education (EE'08). Proceedings. |publisher=[[WSEAS]]|year=2008 |isbn=978-960-6766-862 }} ==External links== *[http://yacas.sourceforge.net/ Yacas Sourceforge website] *[http://sourceforge.net/projects/yacas/ Sourceforge project page] *[http://people.math.aau.dk/~sorenh/software/GUYacas/index.html GUYacas]: Graphical User Interface to Yacas on Windows (standalone). *[http://www.mathpiper.org Mathpiper] A fork of Yacas in Java. {{Computer algebra systems}} [[Category:Free computer algebra systems]] [[Category:Free software programmed in C++]] {{Compu-lang-stub}}
